page.title: 09ULNABY HALL FARM-CONTINUED.
page.content: {Farming}at Ulnaby Hall consists mostly of arable crops with some dairying. The main{crops}are, potatoes, barley and wheat, which are grown in rotation. A recent change has been the growing of peas. Formerly there was a wider range of crops, but now they tend to specialise. {Markets}for the crops include frozen chip companies, Newcastle market and some of the grain goes to Farmways (see previous pages).However there are storage and grinding facilities on the farm. {Yields}are being improved by the use of fertilizers, spraying with pesticides and the introduction of new crop varieties. There is increasing use of{machinery which has contributed to specialization on the farm.
